title: 'Rohit, Kohli absence hurts': Ex-cricketer on low ticket sales; India-Pak Asia Cup clash impacted
description: Aakash Chopra suggests that the slower-than-expected ticket sales for the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match are significantly impacted by the absence of star players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Trump joined fans in chanting "USA! USA!" and visited the Yankees' clubhouse. The team paid tribute to first responders, wearing NYPD and FDNY hats.

description: Charlie Kirk's casket was flown to Arizona on Air Force Two, accompanied by Vice President JD Vance and his wife, Usha, following Kirk's tragic shooting death in Utah. Vance, a long-time friend of Kirk, assisted in carrying the casket. The FBI is offering a $100,000 reward for information on the shooter, who remains at large.

title: Sikkim landslide: Four dead, three missing in Yangthang; rescue ops under way
description: A devastating landslide in Upper Rimbi, West Sikkim, claimed the lives of at least four people and left three others missing. The tragedy struck early Friday in Yangthang constituency, prompting a swift response from police, SSB personnel, and local villagers. Rescue efforts are ongoing to find the missing individuals amidst challenging conditions.

description: Utah authorities have released more close-up images of a person of interest in the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk, a Donald Trump ally, at Utah University. The FBI is offering a $100,000 reward for information leading to the suspect's arrest. Kirk was shot while attending an event, and videos show a dark figure on a rooftop.

title: FIFA receives 1.5 million World Cup ticket applications in 24 hours
description: Successful applicants will be notified via email starting September 29 and given designated time slots to purchase tickets beginning October 1

title: Asia Cup: 'We have best spinner in the world' – Pakistan coach fires warning at India
description: As Pakistan gears up for the Asia Cup, coach Mike Hesson acknowledges India's confidence and strength, particularly their world-class spinners. He emphasizes Pakistan's focus on improving daily, highlighting the team's strong bowling attack led by Mohammad Nawaz. While recognizing the batting lineup's development, Hesson stresses the importance of collective performance in adapting to varying conditions in Dubai.

title:
Tracing the history of colonial powers
in Tamil land through charts, maps
description: European sailors prepared maps and diagrams mainly for space and direction. But they have so far remained unused. Recently, 1,862 maps of forts, armouries, granaries, mints, and treasuries — selected from the Tamil Nadu State Archives — have been uploaded on Tamil Digital Library. They will be the invaluable resources for researchers

title: The hands behind the golu dolls of Bommaikara Theru in Kancheepuram
description: Asthagiri street, known as Bommaikara Theru, in Kancheepuram was once filled with doll makers whose craft defined Navaratri. Today, only a handful of families remain, balancing tradition with changing demand and rising expenses.

title: The caste tensions that sparked after T.N. Scheduled Caste activist Immanuel Sekaran’s murder in 1957
description: The events, starting with riots at Mudukulathur, continue to dominate the public discourse. While the Scheduled Castes were among the adversely impacted people, police firing at Keezhathooval, wherein five persons belonging to the Mukkulathors were killed, confounded the situation. Clarity is still not available on every aspect of the episode

description: In the summer of 2025, Shubman Gill led India to their first Test victory at Edgbaston, overcoming the weight of past failures. A journalist's question about India's poor record at the venue fueled Gill's determination. His match-winning innings not only secured the win but also etched Birmingham as a special chapter in his cricketing journey.

Bolsonaro sentenced to 27yrs: Brazil's SC convicts ex-president for coup attempt
description: Jair Bolsonaro, the former president of Brazil, has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison after being convicted by the Supreme Court for attempting a coup following his 2022 electoral defeat. The unprecedented ruling has sparked international backlash, particularly from the US, while inflaming political tensions within Brazil, with supporters claiming political persecution. Despite the ruling, Bolsonaro remains an influential figure.

description: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files,' starring Mithun Chakraborty and Anupam Kher, earned Rs 11.25 crore in its first week, with overseas collections adding Rs 2.50 crore. Day 7 saw approximately Rs 1 crore in domestic earnings. While the film's box office performance lags behind Agnihotri's previous hits like 'The Kashmir Files,' it has surpassed 'The Vaccine War.

title: The physics of light-based computers can change the way AI works
description: Recently, two research teams studied nonlinear interactions between intense light pulses passing through glass fibres and uncovered something unusual. They reported that it’s possible to use the physics of light in optical fibres to perform complex AI tasks potentially much faster and with less energy than traditional computers

The suspect, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, a motel employee, has been arrested and charged with capital murder. The gruesome attack reportedly stemmed from a dispute over a broken washing machine.

After a break from international cricket and a recent fitness test, Rohit is set to play in the upcoming ODI series against Australia.

This widespread dissemination has ignited renewed debate over content moderation policies. Platforms are responding with varied approaches, from warning labels to content removal and age restrictions, highlighting the ongoing challenge of managing violent content online.

description: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

Asia Cup: 'Play hard, play fair' - Rahane hails Surya’s sportsmanship
description: India's Asia Cup 2025 began with a dominant win over UAE, but Suryakumar Yadav's sportsmanship stole the show. He withdrew a run-out appeal, earning praise from Ajinkya Rahane, who highlighted the gesture's significance. Rahane also commented on team balance, noting Arshdeep Singh's absence and suggesting his inclusion alongside Bumrah for quality pace bowling against stronger opponents later in the tournament.

‘He was murdered’: Musk’s reply to Altman who called OpenAI researcher’s death 'suicide'
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said Suchir Balaji's death was a suicide. He mentioned Balaji worked at OpenAI. Altman's statement followed the researcher's death in San Francisco last year. Balaji's parents had earlier dismissed suicide claims. Elon Musk reacted sharply to Altman's remarks. Musk alleged Balaji was murdered. The exchange occurred during an interview with Tucker Carlson.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
description: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: Gabrielle Union: Dad’s hospital bills expose an insurance gap
description: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union spoke about managing money. She highlighted hospital expenses and insurance issues. Union mentioned her father's memory care costs. She also spoke about choosing roles based on financial needs. Dwyane Wade's net worth is $170 million. Gabrielle Union's net worth is $40 million. They share expenses equally. The couple has been together for over ten years.

title: Kawhi chose Clippers over Lakers to avoid LeBron and $28M payout
description: In 2019, Kawhi Leonard chose the Los Angeles Clippers over the Lakers. Reports suggest he avoided playing with LeBron James. He preferred being the main leader. Later, a controversy emerged regarding Leonard's deal with Aspiration. Allegations arose of a scheme to bypass the NBA salary cap. Steve Ballmer denied any involvement. The NBA is investigating the matter.
